Content:: Legislature Judiciary In Sri Lanka, the Leader of the Opposition is the leader of the largest political party in Parliament that is not in government. This is usually the leader of the second-largest party in Parliament. Sajith Premadasa officially took office as Leader of the Opposition on August 20, 2020, after Speaker announces the appointment in parliament.[1][2] In 2016, the Leader of the Opposition received a salary month and other entitlements of a Member of Parliament.[3] The leader of the opposition is entitled to an official residence, office, transport and security equal that of a Cabinet Minister.[4][5] In the Sri Lankan order of precedence, the leader of the opposition is ranked at the level of a Cabinet Minister in the order of precedence.
